title: [e_commerce] Low Conversion Rate
description: The average conversion rate is only 9%, which is significantly lower than industry benchmarks (typically around 2-5% for e-commerce). This indicates that the website may not be effectively converting visitors into buyers.
recommendations: Analyze user behavior to identify drop-off points
business_impact: Improving conversion rates can lead to increased revenue and better ROI on marketing spend.

title: [e_commerce] Over-reliance on Online Acquisition
description: The majority of customers (48 out of 200) were acquired through online channels, which may indicate a lack of diversification in acquisition strategies. This could pose a risk if online channels face disruptions.
recommendations: Diversify acquisition channels by investing in offline marketing
Explore partnerships with other businesses for cross-promotion
business_impact: Diversifying acquisition channels can mitigate risks associated with reliance on a single source.

title: High Missing Data in user_id
description: 459 records (30.6%) have missing values in user_id

title: Cancelled Status
description: Found 29 records (5.8%) with 'cancelled' status in orders
business_impact: Revenue impact from 29 items (5.8%)

title: [e_commerce] High Average Order Value
description: The average total amount per order is 853,682.20, indicating that customers are spending significantly on each transaction. However, this could also suggest that fewer customers are making larger purchases.
recommendations: Introduce loyalty programs to encourage repeat purchases
Explore bundling products to increase average order size
business_impact: Higher average order values can improve profitability, but reliance on fewer customers can be risky.

title: [e_commerce] Inactive Customer Segment
description: There are 13 inactive customers in the dataset, which could indicate a loss of engagement and potential revenue. The average lifetime value of active customers is significantly high, suggesting that re-engaging inactive customers could be beneficial.
recommendations: Launch re-engagement campaigns targeting inactive customers
Analyze reasons for inactivity and address them
business_impact: Re-engaging inactive customers can lead to increased sales and improved customer retention.

title: [e_commerce] High Discount Rates on Orders
description: The average discount rate is 7%, with some orders reaching up to 20%. This could indicate aggressive discounting strategies that might impact profit margins.
recommendations: Review pricing strategies to reduce reliance on discounts
Implement value-added services instead of discounts
business_impact: Reducing discount rates can improve profit margins and enhance brand perception.

title: [e_commerce] Low Conversion Rate
description: The average conversion rate is only 9%, which is significantly below industry standards for e-commerce, typically ranging from 2% to 5%. This indicates that a large number of users are visiting the site but not making purchases.
recommendations: Enhance user experience on the website
Analyze user behavior to identify drop-off points
business_impact: Improving the conversion rate can significantly increase revenue without the need for additional traffic.

title: [e_commerce] Dependence on Online Acquisition Channel
description: The majority of customers (48 out of 200) are acquired through online channels, indicating a heavy reliance on this channel for customer acquisition.
recommendations: Diversify marketing strategies to include offline and mobile channels
Explore partnerships and collaborations to widen reach
business_impact: Diversifying acquisition channels can mitigate risks associated with changes in online marketing effectiveness.

title: [e_commerce] High Average Lifetime Value
description: The average lifetime value of customers is quite high at 93,798.02, indicating that the business has the potential to generate significant revenue from each customer over time.
recommendations: Develop loyalty programs to increase repeat purchases
business_impact: Maximizing customer lifetime value can lead to sustainable growth and profitability.

title: [e_commerce] High Stock Levels with Low Sales
description: The average stock quantity is 227.34, but with a low conversion rate, there is a risk of overstocking products that may not sell well, leading to increased holding costs.
recommendations: Conduct market analysis to align stock with demand
business_impact: Reducing excess inventory can lower costs and improve cash flow.

title: [e_commerce] High Cancellation Rate
description: With 13 out of 500 orders marked as cancelled, this indicates a cancellation rate of 2.6%, which may suggest issues with order fulfillment or customer satisfaction.
business_impact: Reducing cancellations can improve customer satisfaction and increase overall sales.
